summary: The 'Stop Mental Health Stigma in Our Communities Act of 2025' aims to improve behavioral health within the Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander (AANHPI) population. It mandates a national outreach and education strategy by the Secretary of Health and Human Services to reduce stigma, promote culturally appropriate services, and address mental health disparities. The bill also requires systematic reviews and reports on the AANHPI youth behavioral health crisis and the behavioral health workforce shortage within the AANHPI community, including recommendations for improvement and increased funding.
